text: The Senate Judiciary Committee is holding a hearing on the Kavanaugh nomination even though millions of pages of documents from his White House tenure have not been released.

Reauthorization of the CHGME program will ensure that we can help grow the specialized workforce needed to adequately care for our nation’s children. I urge President Trump to swiftly pass and sign this measure into law. https://t.co/VdTy0uo6B2
I’m praying for Bryan Chamberlain and his family. I’m also reflecting on the risks the public servants across our state and nation take to do their jobs each day. https://t.co/jpVBwLXvuK

My staff is in contact with the CDC and the Philadelphia Department of Public Health, and we’re monitoring the situation. Following yesterday’s incident at JFK, this further underscores the need for reauthorizing the Pandemic and All-Hazards Preparedness Act. https://t.co/uRrsS1QaCO

The Administration and Senate Republicans are hiding basic documents about Judge Kavanaugh from the American people. I applaud @SenBooker, @MazieHirono and @SenatorLeahy for releasing these materials.
Wishing all the best to those celebrating Rosh Hashanah and the start of the High Holy Days. Shana Tova!

My office is monitoring this incident; including visiting the site and talking to officials on the ground. To all those in the area, please continue to heed the calls of local first responders. https://t.co/lSNyuFc3bE

This morning I have the honor of attending the remembrance ceremony at the Flight 93 National Memorial in Shanksville, PA. I pray for these heroes, their families and all those who lost their lives in the attacks that took place 17 years ago today.

As another storm bears down on our Eastern Coast, @realDonaldTrump’s  attention should be on the safety and needs of those impacted rather than purposefully misleading tweets about death toll numbers of those this Administration failed during the last storm.

Dr. Christine Blasey Ford has bravely come forward and deserves to be heard. What she describes in her interview is a violent sexual assault, which should be disqualifying for a nominee to a lifetime appointment to the Supreme Court.
Wishing those observing Yom Kippur tonight a meaningful and easy fast. G'mar Chatimah Tovah.
The Administration should direct the FBI to investigate this matter as part of its standard background check process after which Dr. Ford and Judge Kavanaugh should testify in front of Congress.
The Administration needs to instruct the FBI to reopen Judge Kavanaugh’s background check and investigate Dr. Ford’s account of being sexually assaulted.
It’s shameful that Senate Republicans are now bullying Dr. Ford. There should be a proper FBI background investigation and then a hearing instead of this unnecessary rush to vote.
To appease far right extremists, this Administration is attempting to bully vulnerable people who do not have a voice. This mean-spirited plan is an abomination. https://t.co/BaPw5WbeRD

Today is the 10th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act, which reinstated Congress’ inclusive definition of disability after the Supreme Court narrowed the definition—Democrats and Republicans coming together to benefit over 61 million Americans!

Dr. Ford is credible and persuasive.  She is also unbelievably brave. Until I heard her talking about what she experienced, I didn’t fully appreciate the terror she felt in that moment, the horror of the physical assault and the psychological trauma of believing she might die.

I believe Dr. Christine Blasey Ford.  It is appalling that the White House and Senate Republicans would move forward with this nomination without an FBI investigation into these allegations. As I have said before, I will vote against his nomination.
Since yesterday’s testimony, many of my constituents have come forward to share their experiences with sexual violence.
The Administration should allow the FBI to do their job without political interference so they can follow the facts wherever they lead. https://t.co/tyLkKfYii1
This Administration continues to fail migrant children by carrying out cruel policies that will do long-term damage to them, their families and our nation. https://t.co/DZ6SxGFSpy

The demand for talent in #STEM fields continues to grow. With a new school year in full swing, I’m pleased to see the #IgniteMyFuture program continues today in New Oxford with more on the way in Harrisburg. They’re helping teachers develop 21st-century skills in their students.

I believe Dr. Christine Blasey Ford when she says she was the victim of sexual assault. I believe the other victims of sexual abuse and assault who have contacted me and my office in recent days.  I hear you; I believe you; I am listening to you. https://t.co/wNf0Wl7wTM
President Trump’s mocking of Dr. Ford is offensive. Dr. Ford bravely came forward to recount being sexually assaulted. She deserves to be heard and respected, not mocked.

I commend the work of @PAAttorneyGen Josh Shapiro. This bill is an important step in supporting victims of sexual assault and I urge the @PaSenate to pass this measure. https://t.co/qtFbPOpIv3
I commend those who spoke out across Pennsylvania yesterday to oppose attempts to privatize the postal service. https://t.co/cJ9WzRV2Qc

Carmela Apolonio Hernandez and her children face life-threatening danger in their home country, which is why I have pushed the Administration to treat them fairly and appropriately evaluate their asylum claim.

In honor of #NationalComingOutDay I commit to continue being an ally in the fight for equality and commend the bravery of all individuals who have come out as LGBTQ.
Pennsylvania has lost two dedicated public servants this week, Representatives O’Brien and Kavulich. My thoughts are with their families
I’m thankful to law enforcement who discovered these explosives. Whoever has engaged in these violent acts must be held fully accountable. https://t.co/50WhFcUgg4

I’m closely monitoring the situation in Squirrel Hill. I’m praying for all those impacted and thankful to our law enforcement officers who responded. Our state and nation will stand with the Tree of Life Synagogue along with the entire Pittsburgh community.
If you have information or need assistance from the FBI regarding the shooting at the Tree of Life Synagogue, please call 412-432-4400

Today, our Commonwealth and country stand in solidarity with the Jewish community of Pittsburgh. We mourn the loss of eleven lives at Tree of Life Synagogue in Squirrel Hill and pray for their families.
Beautiful vigil tonight in Pittsburgh. The people of this city have shown tremendous strength and support for one another.  We are stronger than hate.

Remembering those we lost: Joyce Fienberg, Richard Gottfried, Rose Mallinger, Jerry Rabinowitz, David and Cecil Rosenthal, Bernice and Sylvan Simon, Daniel Stein, Melvin Wax, Irving Younger. May their memories be a blessing.

Pressuring and forcing Attorney General Sessions to resign is an unacceptable effort to interfere with the chain of command in the Russia investigation. This is part of President Trump’s pattern of obstructing Special Counsel Mueller’s independent investigation.

I pray for the victims of this shooting and their families, and I am thankful for the brave law enforcement officers who responded. Our nation must act to confront gun violence by passing legislation to reduce the likelihood of mass shootings.

This is nothing more than a mean-spirited, cruel assault on vulnerable people seeking asylum. This will do NOTHING to make our nation safer. Congress should immediately put an end to this policy. https://t.co/fDpCIdghrJ

I’ve said from the beginning that we needed to protect Special Counsel Mueller and his investigation. The President has tried to interfere with this investigation at every turn, and Congress must take action.
